//: Volume+barrel length based off a Bond Arms derringer. with extra length in the barrel.
description: A crudely made double barrel pistol firing .38 Special ammo.  Unfortunately, the name is less about the double barrels and more about the number of shots you'll get before it breaks down on you.
A six-shot revolver, produced since 1899 and known as the most popular handgun of the 20th century.  It has a swing-out cylinder for ease of reloading.

variants.description: The Model 10 is one of the oldest firearm models still in production, and most produced handguns, with production dating back to 1899.  Starting life as the Model 1899 Hand Ejector, it only picked up the current name of Model 10 in the 1950s.  Despite .38 Special and .357 Magnum being the same caliber, Model 10s were produced to handle blackpowder loads, and while modern smokeless loads of .38 Special work fine, .357 Magnum could cause the Model 10 to catastrophically fail.

//: 101.6mm + 39.4mm max OAL for 38spl. Revolvers just built different.

description: A home-made rifle.  It is simply a pipe attached to a stock, with a hammer to strike the single round it holds.
A compact, double-action-only revolver designed for easy concealment, with a stainless steel cylinder and aluminum frame.

variants.description: The Ruger LCR (Lightweight Compact Revolver) is a modern revolver, starting production in just 2010.  It's a lightweight, aluminum-framed revolver, designed for conceal carry with its double-action-only trigger, lightweight and compact size.  Due to the double-action trigger, it is more possible to carry it in your pocket instead of a holster due to the heavy trigger, but still ill-advised.

//: 47mm + 39.4mm max OAL for 38spl. Revolvers just built different.

name.//: This looks like a classic revolver, from a western

//: This is the Colt Python 2020 6-inch version.
description: A six inch revolver chambered in .357 Magnum/.38 Special.  Favorite of sheriffs and post-Cataclysm survivor group leaders.
//2: Price of one according to colt's own website. Goddamn.

variants.description: Made by Colt, this six inch six-shooter is one of the most lauded revolvers ever produced.  Can fire .38 Special and .357 Magnum.

description: A revolver chambered in .357, with a 6 inch barrel and 7 shots.
//1: took 5mm off `longest_side` so it can fit regular holsters

variants.description: Introduced in the 90's, Smith & Wesson's model 686 'Plus' features a robust stainless steel frame, an adjustable front sight and a seventh shot that's sure to save your life.

description: A revolver chambered in .357, with a 6 inch barrel and 6 shots.

variants.description: An innovative, futuristic looking revolver designed by Emilio Ghisoni after developing the Mateba, its most distinctive feature is its barrel, aligned with the bottom chamber of its hexagonal cylinder to alleviate muzzle flip.

description: Short, stout, and compact, this stainless steel revolver is a handy dispenser of .357-magnum, or lower-power .38-caliber, cartridges.  Six rounds fit within the weapon, though its small stature and short barrel ensure that each pull of the trigger is all but a pyrotechnic spectacle: flashy, loud, and jumpy.

variants.description: A small frame, stainless-steel Brazilian wheel gun with rubberized grips, a serrated front sight, and a satin finish, boasting a 6-round cylinder of .357-magnum persuasion.  Affordable, before the world collapsed, and confidently asserted by Rossi themselves to be the ideal carry gun for its rounded butt and 3-inch barrel, you aren't wholly sure that such assertions accounted for zombies.

//: 72.6mm + 39.4mm max OAL for 38spl. Revolvers just built different.
//2: Dimensions are 19.3x13.3x3.7 cm, with the final result trimmed by 35% to account for the inherent empty spaces.
//3: Yes, the revolver is actually 193 mm long rather than 19 cm, but I deemed not having it fit in a standard-sized pocket because of a 3 mm difference to be silly.
//4: 3 to 3.5-inch groups at 10 yards shooting off-handed: https://www.shootingillustrated.com/content/review-rossi-rp-63-revolver/

description: This fine lever-action rifle is chambered in the powerful .357 Magnum cartridge, with an 20" barrel with a tube-fed magazine.  Go get 'em cowboy!

variants.description: The 1873 is a rifle platform developed all the way in, unsurprisingly, 1873.  This one is a fairly faithful Uberti reproduction, although the original 1873s pre-dated .357 Magnum, and even .38 Special.  This one has a case-hardened finish, wood furniture, and octagonal barrel.

description: This lever-action rifle is chambered in the powerful .357 Magnum cartridge, with an 20" barrel with a tube-fed magazine.  Go get 'em cowboy!

variants.description: The R92 is a widely successful line of lever-action rifles from Rossi, featuring a wide array of different calibers and barrel lengths.  These aim to be less reproductions of old rifles, but rather modern takes on the lever-action formula.  This particular one features wooden furniture, a 20" barrel, and 10 rounds of .357 Magnum or .38 Special.

description: This fine lever-action rifle is chambered in the powerful .357 Magnum cartridge, with an 16" barrel with a tube-fed magazine.  Go get 'em cowboy!

variants.description: The R92 is a widely successful line of lever-action rifles from Rossi, featuring a wide array of different calibers and barrel lengths.  These aim to be less reproductions of old rifles, but rather modern takes on the lever-action formula.  This particular one features wooden furniture, a 16" barrel, and 8 rounds of .357 Magnum or .38 Special.

description: This .38 revolver is quite small and lightweight, due to its short barrel and aluminum material.

variants.description: A modern version of the Airweight, the 642 is a lightweight .38 caliber revolver, made with an aluminum frame.

//: 47.8mm + 30.5mm max OAL for 38spl. Revolvers just built different.
